subject: Art
title: Responsive Typography
description: Adapting type size and layout across different screen sizes.

hook.text: A headline that looks perfect on a desktop wraps awkwardly on a phone. Body text sized for mobile becomes microscopic on a widescreen. Responsive typography adapts to every screen size fluidly.

buildup.text: Techniques: fluid type (CSS clamp() ‚Äî scales smoothly between min and max sizes), breakpoint-based sizing (different sizes at different widths), and responsive line length (max-width on containers to control measure).

discovery.text: The golden formula: clamp(1rem, 2.5vw, 2rem) ‚Äî sets a minimum, a fluid middle that scales with viewport width, and a maximum. One line of CSS, perfect scaling across all devices.

twist.text: Don't just scale size ‚Äî adjust everything: line height (tighter on mobile where lines are shorter), letter spacing (slightly looser at small sizes), and hierarchy ratios (smaller difference between heading and body on mobile).

climax.text: Test your typography at five widths: 320px (small phone), 768px (tablet), 1024px (laptop), 1440px (desktop), 1920px (large monitor). Each should be comfortable to read with appropriate line length and size.

punchline.text: Good typography adapts to the reader's device. The text should feel native everywhere.

quiz.question: What does the CSS clamp() function do for typography?
options: Locks font size to one value
Creates fluid type that scales smoothly between a minimum and maximum size based on viewport width
